title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 16.3 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 16.3 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) For the purposes of Section
404
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law and these regulations, a special number plate shall
be a number plate or a set of number plates containing not more than eight
letters, numerals or combination thereof, and which is reserved by the
commissioner for issuance in accordance with the provisions of this Part, and
shall be either a reserved series or a personalized plate. For the purposes of
determining the number of letters or numerals, a space or dash shall be
considered a letter or numeral. However, special number plate issued to a
motorcycle registered pursuant to Section
411-a
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law shall contain not more than six letters, numerals or combination thereof. (b) A reserved series is a series of special
number plates reserved for issuance to vehicles owned by public officers, physicians, accredited representatives of the press or other groups. (c) For purposes of this Part, a personalized
plate is any number plate that bears a plate number that is a combination of
letters and/or numerals requested by the applicant and is issued under Vehicle
and Traffic Law, Sections 404 or 411-a. P ersonalized plates shall include, but
need not be limited to, plates that have a picture or logo next to, or as a
part of the background of, the plate number. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
16.3

Amended

New

York State Register August 10, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 32, eff. 8/10/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
